intro: Pedicularis nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked lady's slipper, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, slipper-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in open, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine meadows and tundra environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest in both botanical research and conservation efforts.
